instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
hello,
please need help for mainboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> model
i have ppbus good and led charging
fan no turn
bios flash ok same problem
All big coil have good diode value
When plug power, i have 0.217A without battery
thanks for help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
This MCP platform requires pressing power button to turn on.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>.
I supposed that <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> stays high normally.

Do you get <CAPACITOR>C7755</CAPACITOR> correct voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
yes i have already test to trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> it's for that i have 0.217A, before press i have 0A
on  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> i have 3.3V when push power and on  <CAPACITOR>C7755</CAPACITOR>  yes i have 0.9V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
on  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> i have 3.3V when push power"
Drops to 0V after power button is released?
Check L7330 voltage, at same time.
What about <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
no, i push power button and  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> have 3.3V always
on L7330 i have 1.35V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3V always when push

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
i have lot damage around <CHIP>U7500</CHIP>
i have clean all pad and solder, you think this chip is dead and can make this problem?
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
i have remove <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> and fan turn
i have 0.310A
think i have found the problem, need found ic on donor board tomorrow and check if it's better or if i have line defect to this chip

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not start after liquid damage
threads.message:
"i have remove <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> and fan turn"
If you've turned on the board without <CHIP>U7500</CHIP>, you are really lucky if <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> didn't blow out.

Do NOT do this ever again.
Never ever let high-side MOSFET (in buck converter) with Gate pin "on air".
